title: Select head of government in parliamentary systems

content.question: Parliamentary systems differ from presidential systems in that the head of government in a parliamentary system

choices.label: is selected by the legislature, while a President is not
is elected directly in a national election, while a President is not
is responsible only to the voters and not to the legislature
can be dismissed only if found guilty of crimes in an impeachment process
typically has a specified term limit, while a President does not

content.answer: is selected by the legislature, while a President is not
